runs.comm: loosener from Shoaib, and Kieswetter is nicely in line to defend
fuller and quicker, again Kieswetter defends watchfully right under his eyes
Shoaib pushes one slightly wider of off stump, Kieswetter has a good look and leaves well alone
quick, but misdirected towards middle and leg and Kieswetter is off the mark, clipping down to fine leg

clipped in the air over a leaping Umar Akmal at square leg! That's got to count as a missed chance, he only got a finger to it but you've got to hold onto those to give your side a chance in a game like this
good response from Shoaib, a pacy delivery on off stump that holds its line to beat the outside edge of Davies' bat
ooh, that's not a good start from Umar Gul, stepping over the line to give away a no-ball and a free hit
Kieswetter takes full toll! He backs away to leg and slaps a length delivery over cover point for six! It looked ungainly, but it was mighty effective - that sailed over the rope!
a bouncer is the response from Gul, Kieswetter pulls to fine leg, making sure to roll his wrists on the shot
well-timed punch through cover from Davies. It was a length delivery just outside off and he was quickly into position to thread it between the fielders
with 10 runs already conceded off the over, Kieswetter is quite happy to leave this length delivery outside off well alone
cracking pull infront of square! A middling length from Gul - not the bouncer by any means - but Kieswetter picked up the length in a flash to swipe the ball very hard to midwicket
that's an even better shot! Gul goes full and Kieswetter drills a drive between mid-off and cover. Great timing once again, the ball racing to the boundary as no-one in the field moves a muscle
just short of a good length from Shoaib, Davies stays deep in the crease and defends solidly back down the track
slightly shorter from Shoaib, Davies aims a flicked pull to bisect the men at square leg and fine leg and pick up a couple

and the change of angle works straight away! It was a length delivery - nothing that special about it - and Davies tried to nudge him into the leg side. The ball just seemed to stick in the wicket and pop up, he played too early at it and gave Umar the simplest of catches

two wickets in two balls, again Umar is involved! Kieswetter is run out at the non-striker's end! Bopara punched his first ball - full, outside off - straight to Umar at backward point and immediately called "no!" but his partner was halfway down the track. The throw was on target and he's a good few inches short!
slower ball from Shoaib, this one really didn't come out right though and arrived at Bopara as a high full toss. It was very slow, and dipping, so not a no-ball
back of a length, outside off. Bopara looks to guide him down to third man but can't beat a diving Fawad Alam
pushed up full and wide outside off, Collingwood steps forward but shoulders arms
the archetypal 'nurdle' from Colly, and he's going to get off the mark as Umar rushes in from midwicket but a touch of side-spin forces the fumble
back of a length, outside off, and Bopara chops him down to third man for one
good length from Umar Gul, and he's nice and tight on off stump too. Collingwood has time on his side, though, and patiently defends back to the bowler
a touch too straight from Gul, and Collingwood nudges the ball to Yousuf's right at mid-on and steals a quick single
bouncer from Gul, but it's much too short and is also angling down the leg side - wide called
better delivery, landing on a length on middle, and Bopara taps to mid-on
on a length, outside off. Collingwood won't be tempted, however, and raises his bat to leave
glanced away very fine by Collingwood as Shoaib slips onto leg stump, but the man at fine leg charges round to cut it off

ouch! Short from Shoaib, not quite the bouncer but Collingwood stepped back and tried to pull him up and over square leg ... the ball rushed on to him, though, striking him right in the stomach. Just a little wince from the batsman, nothing more. Long stare from Shoaib
slower ball, yorker length but well wide of off. Collingwood digs it out to point
quick, length delivery on middle and leg. Collingwood nudges to midwicket
length delivery slapped straight to cover
appeal first ball as Bopara is struck on the pad! But that's pitched outside leg
watchful defence into the off side
ooh, not great from Ajmal, a little too leg-side and he's easily clipped away
Collingwood backs away but appears to read this off the pitch, and can't get it away through cover
Colly looks to whip this leg side, the ball strikes pad and loops to silly mid-off, but that was nowhere near the edge of the bat
flicked away to midwicket for a couple
cracking delivery from Shoaib! Great length, Bopara was only half forward and he's beaten on the outside edge by a hint of away movement through the air. No luck for the bowler though
that is off the edge, but it's a thick edge and flies harmlessly down to third man for one
what a shot! Collingwood charges down - to Shoaib Akhtar, of all people - and whips him over square leg with plenty of bottom hand! The ball never got very high, but flew metres over the boundary
slower ball from Shoaib, and a reasonable one, but Razzaq's geriatric fielding at mid-off lets them through for a couple
Shoaib is getting frustrated by his fielders here, and rightly so! Collingwood pulled a short ball out to deep square leg, where Shahzaib fumbles and they're back for two more
full, fast and wide of off stump. Collingwood drives straight to mid-off, where Razzaq stops it cleanly this time
landing on leg stump and rushing straight on, Bopara gets forward and drives to long-on
Collingwood's definitely reading these off the pitch and not out of the hand, waiting for the ball to bounce and poking defensively into the off side
orthodox offspinner, it beats the bat and strikes the pad, but nowhere near the stumps
too wide from Ajmal, and Collingwood slashes him away down to the third man boundary
considerable spin for Ajmal, beating the inside edge as Collingwood tries to whip through midwicket
doosra, pushed slightly wider of off. Collingwood gets forward and opens the face of the blade to pick up two more behind square on the off side
legspinner to start, landing on middle and leg and tapped back to the bowler
drifting towards leg stump, and he nudges him away for a single
leg-stump half-volley, flicked out to deep square leg
quicker one from Afridi, this one slid straight on to strike the pad. There's half an appeal, but that was heading way down leg
full and straight, pushed back to the bowler
quick single to finish, as Bopara stays deep in the crease and pushes to midwicket
doosra, not picked but well-played off the pitch as it's pushed to backward point for a dashing single
landing on leg stump from round the wicket, flicked to Afridi at square leg

edged, and a tumbling Hafeez at slip gratefully accepts the chance! It was the doosra again for sure, landing on the perfect spot as Collingwood pushed forward with no great certainty. A wicket for Ajmal, but is it too late for Pakistan?
Ajmal goes back over the wicket, and tosses up an offspinner, left alone by Morgan
speared in closer to off stump, Morgan drops the ball into space at cover to get off the mark
Bopara taps towards mid-on, who is surely too deep as the batsmen charge through for one. The fielder fired in a shy at the stumps that could have been interesting if it had hit...
pushed quietly into the off side
touch shorter from Afridi, Bopara gets back and carefully defends once more
Bopara getting a touch nervy here, blocking to mid-on and calling Morgan for a single before changing his mind
another dot ball, defended nervously
sweet release for Bopara, dreadful short ball from Afridi and Bopara had an age to get back and smack over midwicket for four

gone  this time! Fair to say Bopara never looked remotely happy out there, another short ball here but much quicker, trapping Bopara on the thigh as he looked to pull and though it looked to be going over, he's given out
Morgan gets back and chops to point
touch fuller from Hafeez, Morgan clears his front leg and clunks this straight back down the ground for four. No fuss at all
having taken the boundary he's happy to pop forward and defend
touch shorter here, Morgan gives himself a fraction of room and cuts to point for a single
pushed back to the bowler carefully, Yardy content to have a look first up
good over in the end, finishes with Yardy blocking carefully
good delivery from Afridi, pacey and on a good length and line, Morgan defends
oh good shot this, Morgan just waits a fraction and opens the face at the last minute on a drive to pick a gap at cover, stroking stylishly for three
Yardy shuffles into place from outside leg stump and dabs this towards midwicket for a single
good work from Morgan again, makes this look so easy, too short from Afridi and Morgan cuts crisply to the deep point boundary
bouncer in response! Really swift from Afridi, almost cleaned Morgan up! Akmal had no chance either!
more conventional this time and Morgan defends
carefully worked away to point for a single
touch of flight from Hafeez, Morgan clears his front leg and thwacks this imperiously down the ground for four, England nearly there now
Morgan itching to finish things off in style, but gets a good ball he can only defend
just a fraction short, Morgan leaps back and cuts in a flash down to deep point. Just a boundary needed now
Yardy pushes this back down the wicket to Hafeez
this should be it! Yardy strokes through cover gently and though the fielder chases manfully England run all four and take the match and series. Easy as you like!
